citations.desc: Attending veterinarian and adequate veterinary care (dealers and exhibitors).
citations.narrative:
No written program of veterinary care was available for review. A written program veterinary care is requied to
demonstrate adequate veterinary care and Attending Veterinarian oversight of health care and husbandry is being
provided to the animals. A written program of veterinary care covering all animals must be completed by May 14, 2023.

Acquisition records for all animals which were acquired after the USDA license was issued were incomplete. The rabbit,
pig, calf, and goats used in exhibition were not included on the animals on hand list nor had acquisition records available.
The acquisition records did not include full address of person from whom animal was purchased from, USDA license
number or vehicle license number/state ID number if unlicensed, and date of purchase as required. Records need to be
complete to ensure proper documentation of all animal acquisitions and dispositions and enable disease control and
public health monitoring if needed. Acquisition and disposition records on all animals must include: name, full address and
USDA License (or vehicle license/state ID if not licensed), date acquired or sold/given away or death and species and
number of animals. A complete list of all animals on hand shall be kept up to date. To be corrected by May 1, 2023.

One rabbit was housed in a primary enclosure that with a capybera (full time) and a kangaroo (daytime). Rabbits should
not be housed with other species to prevent injury and disease transmission. Rabbit must be provided with single species
housing in an appropriate enclosure. To be corrected by May 1, 2023.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with licensee.
n

narrative:
2.40(a)(1) 
   
Attending veterinarian and adequate veterinary care (dealers and exhibitors). 
No written program of veterinary care was available for review.  A written program veterinary care is requied to 
demonstrate adequate veterinary care and Attending Veterinarian oversight of health care and husbandry is being 
provided to the animals.  A written program of veterinary care covering all animals must be completed by May 14, 2023. 
2.75(b)(1) 
   
Records: Dealers and exhibitors. 
Acquisition records for all animals which were acquired after the USDA license was issued were incomplete.  The rabbit, 
pig, calf, and goats used in exhibition were not included on the animals on hand list nor had acquisition records available. 
The acquisition records did not include full address of person from whom animal was purchased from, USDA license 
number or vehicle license number/state ID number if unlicensed, and date of purchase as required.  Records need to be 
complete to ensure proper documentation of all animal acquisitions and dispositions and enable disease control and 
public health monitoring if needed. Acquisition and disposition records on all animals must include: name, full address and 
USDA License (or vehicle license/state ID if not licensed), date acquired or sold/given away or death and species and 
number of animals.  A complete list of all animals on hand shall be kept up to date.  To be corrected by May 1, 2023. 
3.58(a) 
   
Classification and separation.

One rabbit was housed in a primary enclosure that with a capybera (full time) and a kangaroo (daytime).  Rabbits should 
not be housed with other species to prevent injury and disease transmission.  Rabbit must be provided with single species 
housing in an appropriate enclosure.  To be corrected by May 1, 2023. 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with licensee. 
 
 n
